alert.note: Alert for Natchitoches; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 2:21PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Natchitoches and northeastern Sabine Parishes through 300 PM CST... At 221 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Many, or 14 miles southwest of Natchitoches, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Natchitoches, Provencal, Natchez, Clarence, Robeline, Grand Ecore, Clear Lake, Hagewood and St. Maurice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for north central and northwestern Louisiana.
